metadata.title: CVE-2020-5267 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In ActionView before versions 6.0.2.2 and 5.2.4.2, there is a possible XSSvulnerability in ActionView's JavaScript literal escape helpers. Views thatuse the `j` or `escape_javascript` methods may be susceptible to XSSattacks. The issue is fixed in versions 6.0.2.2 and 5.2.4.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-5267` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

rails - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-actioncable - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-actionmailbox - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-actionmailer - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-actionpack - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-actiontext - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-actionview - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-activejob - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-activemodel - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-activerecord - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-activestorage - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-activesupport - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-rails - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
ruby-railties - 2:5.2.4.1+dfsg-2
No subscription required
